glsa.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows when processing FLAC and ASF streams.

background.p: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player.

description.p: Damian Frizza and Alfredo Ortega (Core Security Technologies) discovered a stack-based buffer overflow within the open_flac_file() function in the file demux_flac.c when parsing tags within a FLAC file (CVE-2008-0486). A buffer overflow when parsing ASF headers, which is similar to CVE-2006-1664, has also been discovered (CVE-2008-1110).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to play specially crafted FLAC or ASF video streams with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
